2 #BaseCSS Base CSS

Basic HTML elements styled and enhanced with extensible classes for a fresh, consistent look and feel.

Source: document/basecss.less, line 1

2.1 #BaseCSS.TypographyFont Typography typeface

SugarCRM interfaces use font Open Sans. Usage: .import-opensans().

Font weights available: 100, 400, 600, 700, 900

Font name can be namespaced, there's an optional variable @{FONT_NAME_PREFIX} in undocumented-components/font.less which can be used to prepend namespace. Here is an example of how it can be done in webpack:

{
   loader: 'less-loader',
   options: {
       modifyVars: {
           'FONT_NAME_PREFIX': projectConfig.projectKey + '-'
       }
   }
}

WORK IN PROGRESS To be added: paragraphs, headers, ordered/unordered lists, ellipsis, emphasis and other font styles, blockquotes, addresses, abbreviations and acronyms.

Source: document/typography.less, line 1

2.2 #BaseCSS.IconsExampleFA Font Awesome

Toggle full screen Open in new window Toggle example guides Toggle HTML markup

Usage: .getFaIcon('ICON_NAME'; 'COLLECTION_NAME'); Obtain icon name when browsing icons available. For example, <i class="fab fa-angellist"></i>. Icon name would be angellist, collection would be fab. The following collections are currently supported:

  • fas, default collection, and included as default in .getFaIcon call.
  • fab, brands collection
  • far, regular collection
  • fasug, custom icons designed by SugarCRM
.MY_ICON_ARROWS_ALT {
  .getFaIcon('arrows-alt'); // no need to specify collection when default
}

.MY_ICON_GITHUB {
  .getFaIcon('github'; 'fab');
  color: @blue;
}

.MY_ICON_SOCCER {
  .getFaIcon('futbol'; 'far');
}

.MY_ICON_SUG_LINK {
  .getFaIcon('sugar-link'; 'fasug');
  color: @red;
}

Note: Font Awesome name can be namespaced, see an example in Typography section on how Open Sans is namespaced. Font Awesome is also namespaced in playground/mfe_template_js example.

Example
Markup 
<div class="display-flex">
    <i class="MY_ICON_ARROWS_ALT"></i>
    <i class="MY_ICON_GITHUB"></i>
    <i class="MY_ICON_SOCCER"></i>
    <i class="MY_ICON_SUG_LINK"></i>
</div>
Source: documented-components/icons.less, line 30

2.3 #BaseCSS.IconsExampleFASUG Font Awesome sugar extended

Toggle full screen Open in new window Toggle example guides Toggle HTML markup

List of custom SugarCRM icons available.

.SUGAR_ICON_ENVELOPE_OPEN { .getFaIcon('envelope-open'; 'fasug'); }
.SUGAR_ICON_SUGAR_LINK { .getFaIcon('sugar-link'; 'fasug'); }
.SUGAR_ICON_TAG_PRIVATE { .getFaIcon('tag-private'; 'fasug'); }
.SUGAR_ICON_CLOCK_PRIVATE { .getFaIcon('clock-o-private'; 'fasug'); }
.SUGAR_ICON_DASHBOARD_DEFAULT { .getFaIcon('dashboard-default'; 'fasug'); }
.SUGAR_ICON_FAVORITE_PRIVATE { .getFaIcon('favorite-private'; 'fasug'); }
.SUGAR_ICON_FILTER_DEFAULT { .getFaIcon('filter-default'; 'fasug'); }

Note: Font Awesome sugar extended name can be namespaced, see an example in Typography section on how Open Sans is namespaced. Font Awesome sugar extended is also namespaced in playground/mfe_template_js example.

Example
Markup 
<div class="display-flex">
    <i class="SUGAR_ICON_ENVELOPE_OPEN"></i>
    <i class="SUGAR_ICON_SUGAR_LINK"></i>
    <i class="SUGAR_ICON_TAG_PRIVATE"></i>
    <i class="SUGAR_ICON_CLOCK_PRIVATE"></i>
    <i class="SUGAR_ICON_DASHBOARD_DEFAULT"></i>
    <i class="SUGAR_ICON_FAVORITE_PRIVATE"></i>
    <i class="SUGAR_ICON_FILTER_DEFAULT"></i>
</div>
Source: documented-components/icons.less, line 92

2.4 #BaseCSS.IconsSizes Icon sizes

Toggle full screen Open in new window Toggle example guides Toggle HTML markup

Icons are sized relative to its parent element. Icons inherit size class (fa-2x, fa-3x, etc) from their parent, see "Markup" section.

.ICON_IGLOO_XS {
  .getFaIcon('igloo');
  .fa-xs;
}

.ICON_IGLOO_SM {
  .getFaIcon('igloo');
  .fa-sm;
}

.ICON_IGLOO_LG {
  .getFaIcon('igloo');
  .fa-lg;
}

.ICON_IGLOO_2X {
  .getFaIcon('igloo');
  .fa-2x;
}

.ICON_IGLOO_3X {
  .getFaIcon('igloo');
  .fa-3x;
}

.ICON_IGLOO_5X {
  .getFaIcon('igloo');
  .fa-5x;
}

.ICON_IGLOO_7X {
  .getFaIcon('igloo');
  .fa-7x;
}

.ICON_IGLOO_10X {
  .getFaIcon('igloo');
  .fa-10x;
}
Example
Markup 
<div class="display-flex">
    <i class="ICON_IGLOO_XS"></i>
    <i class="ICON_IGLOO_SM"></i>
    <i class="ICON_IGLOO_LG"></i>
    <i class="ICON_IGLOO_2X"></i>
    <i class="ICON_IGLOO_3X"></i>
    <i class="ICON_IGLOO_5X"></i>
    <i class="ICON_IGLOO_7X"></i>
    <i class="ICON_IGLOO_10X"></i>
</div>
Source: documented-components/icons.less, line 134

Toggle full screen Open in new window Toggle example guides Toggle HTML markup 

.ICON_ELLIPSIS_V_FIXED_WIDTH {
  .getFaIcon('ellipsis-v');
  .fa-fw;
}

.ICON_EGG_FIXED_WIDTH {
  .getFaIcon('egg');
  .fa-fw;
}

.ICON_FEATHER_FIXED_WIDTH {
  .getFaIcon('feather');
  .fa-fw;
}

.ICON_LOCATION_ARROW_FIXED_WIDTH {
  .getFaIcon('location-arrow');
  .fa-fw;
}

.ICON_ELLIPSIS_V {
  .getFaIcon('ellipsis-v');
}

.ICON_EGG {
  .getFaIcon('egg');
}

.ICON_FEATHER {
  .getFaIcon('feather');
}

.ICON_LOCATION_ARROW {
  .getFaIcon('location-arrow');
}
Example








Markup 
<table cellpadding=10>
    <tr>
        <td>
            <i class="ICON_ELLIPSIS_V_FIXED_WIDTH"></i><br>
            <i class="ICON_EGG_FIXED_WIDTH"></i><br>
            <i class="ICON_FEATHER_FIXED_WIDTH"></i><br>
            <i class="ICON_LOCATION_ARROW_FIXED_WIDTH"></i><br>
        </td>
        <td>
            <i class="ICON_ELLIPSIS_V"></i><br>
            <i class="ICON_EGG"></i><br>
            <i class="ICON_FEATHER"></i><br>
            <i class="ICON_LOCATION_ARROW"></i><br>
        </td>
    </tr>
</table>
</table>

2.6 #BaseCSS.RotatingIcons Rotating icons

Toggle full screen Open in new window Toggle example guides Toggle HTML markup 

.SNOWMAN-FA-2X {
  .fa-2x;
}

.SNOWMAN {
  .getFaIcon('snowman');
}

.SNOWMAN_ROTATE_90 {
  .getFaIcon('snowman');
  .fa-rotate-90;
}

.SNOWMAN_ROTATE_180 {
  .getFaIcon('snowman');
  .fa-rotate-180;
}

.SNOWMAN_ROTATE_270 {
  .getFaIcon('snowman');
  .fa-rotate-270;
}

.SNOWMAN_FLIP_HORIZONTAL {
  .getFaIcon('snowman');
  .fa-flip-horizontal;
}

.SNOWMAN_FLIP_VERTICAL {
  .getFaIcon('snowman');
  .fa-flip-vertical;
}

.SNOWMAN_FLIP_BOTH {
  .getFaIcon('snowman');
  .fa-flip-both;
}
Example
Markup 
<div class="display-flex SNOWMAN-FA-2X">
    <i class="SNOWMAN"></i>
    <i class="SNOWMAN_ROTATE_90"></i>
    <i class="SNOWMAN_ROTATE_180"></i>
    <i class="SNOWMAN_ROTATE_270"></i>
    <i class="SNOWMAN_FLIP_HORIZONTAL"></i>
    <i class="SNOWMAN_FLIP_VERTICAL"></i>
    <i class="SNOWMAN_FLIP_BOTH"></i>
</div>

2.7 #BaseCSS.AnimatingIcons Animating icons

Toggle full screen Open in new window Toggle example guides Toggle HTML markup 

.ICON_ANIM_SPINNER {
  .getFaIcon('spinner');
  .fa-anim('spin', 'SPINNER_ANIMATED_F3GT4D3D');
}

.ICON_ANIM_CIRCLE_NOTCH {
  .getFaIcon('circle-notch');
  .fa-anim('spin', 'CIRCLE_NOTCH_ANIM_F7D79F');
}

.ICON_ANIM_SYNC {
  color: @red;
  .getFaIcon('sync');
  .fa-anim('spin', 'SYNC_ICON_ANIM_324FJ4_Z9R');
}

.ICON_ANIM_COG {
  .getFaIcon('cog');
  .fa-anim('spin', 'COG_ICON_ANIM_32-3V_4FJ4Z9R');
}

.ICON_ANIM_SPINNER_PULSE {
  .getFaIcon('spinner');
  .fa-anim('spin', 'SPINNER_PULSE_ANIMATE_9R-23D');
}

.ICON_ANIM_STROOPWAFEL {
  .getFaIcon('stroopwafel');
  .fa-anim('spin', 'STROOPWAFEL_ICON_ANIM_-40Z9NFJ');
}
Example
Markup 
<div class="display-flex">
    <i class="ICON_ANIM_SPINNER"></i>
    <i class="ICON_ANIM_CIRCLE_NOTCH"></i>
    <i class="ICON_ANIM_SYNC"></i>
    <i class="ICON_ANIM_COG"></i>
    <i class="ICON_ANIM_SPINNER_PULSE"></i>
    <i class="ICON_ANIM_STROOPWAFEL"></i>
</div>

2.9 #BaseCSS.IconsSugarCube SugarCRM cube

Toggle full screen Open in new window Toggle example guides Toggle HTML markup

SugarCRM cube svg is being imported via background. .sugar-cube(), takes two optional parameters, color and size.

When specifying color, symbol # is an illegal value for this property url(). Therefore, # must be replaced by %23.

Example: #000 would be %23000. The value should be also LESS-escaped like so: ~"%23ddd".`

.MY_SUGAR_CUBE_1 {
  .sugar-cube('default', 10vw);
}
.MY_SUGAR_CUBE_2 {
  .sugar-cube(~"%23ddd", 8vw);
}
.MY_SUGAR_CUBE_3 {
  .sugar-cube(~"%23999", 6vw);
}
.MY_SUGAR_CUBE_4 {
  .sugar-cube(~"%23000", 4vw);
}
.MY_SUGAR_CUBE_5 {
  .sugar-cube();
}
Example
Markup 
<section class="display-flex">
    <span class="MY_SUGAR_CUBE_1"></span>
    <span class="MY_SUGAR_CUBE_2"></span>
    <span class="MY_SUGAR_CUBE_3"></span>
    <span class="MY_SUGAR_CUBE_4"></span>
    <span class="MY_SUGAR_CUBE_5"></span>
<section>
Source: documented-components/icons.less, line 504

2.10 #BaseCSS.IconsSugarLogo SugarCRM logo

Toggle full screen Open in new window Toggle example guides Toggle HTML markup

SugarCRM logo svg is being imported via background. .sugar-logo(), takes three optional parameters, color, size, and desaturate.

.MY_SUGAR_LOGO_1 {
  .sugar-logo();
}
.MY_SUGAR_LOGO_2 {
  .sugar-logo(40px; 200px);
}
.MY_SUGAR_LOGO_3 {
  .sugar-logo(24px; 122px; true);
}
Example
Markup 
<section class="display-flex">
    <span class="MY_SUGAR_LOGO_1"></span>
    <span class="MY_SUGAR_LOGO_2"></span>
    <span class="MY_SUGAR_LOGO_3"></span>
<section>
Source: documented-components/icons.less, line 578

2.11 #BaseCSS.Colors Colors

The following colors should be used instead of defining new custom colors or relying on the default css color names.

If you are creating a component and not using one of these color variables, please consider adding it to this list after reviewing it with the UX team.

Double-click on color box to copy less variable to your clipboard.

@mint #18e7d2;
@green #54cb14;
@army #429e10;
@yellow #f4e429;
@orange #fbc02d;
@red #e61718;
@pink #de5af1;
@purple #854edb;
@night #011523;
@blue #0679c8;
@ocean #41b7d1;
@pacific #198cc6;
@teal #1cc8d3;
@coral #da3eac;
@moss #33800d;
@stone #0f7799;
@cider #7e6017;
@rose #ebaaaa;
@cream #fdf8ee;
@black #000;
@grayDarker #111;
@grayDark #222;
@grayDarkish #4d4f50;
@gray #555;
@grayLight #717171;
@grayLighter #f6f6f6;
@white #fff;
@slate #9aa5ad;
@steel #50575b;
Source: documented-components/colors.less, line 1
